message.content:
cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.CL, cs.LG

The paper deals with topic modeling and the analysis of the evolution of semantic content in a scientific field over time. This suggests that it could belong to several sub-categories in computer science, including cs.DL (Digital Libraries), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.CL (Computation and Language), and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Among these, cs.DL and cs.IR are the most likely categories, as they deal specifically with the analysis and organization of large collections of documents, which is the focus of this paper. However, the paper also involves machine learning techniques (LDA) and network analysis, which could place it in the cs.LG and cs.SI categories as well. Finally, the use of natural language processing and text analysis techniques could also make cs.CL a relevant category.
